title: Ensure the work of the enacted lesson reflects the Focus, Coherence, and Rigor required by college- and career-ready standards in mathematics

sections.description: The enacted lesson focuses on the grade-level cluster(s), grade-level content standard(s), or part(s) thereof

ratings.description: The enacted lesson focuses only on mathematics within the grade-level standards
The enacted lesson focuses on mathematics outside the grade-level standards

sections.description: The enacted lesson appropriately relates new content to math content within or across grades

ratings.description: The enacted lesson builds on students' prior skills and understandings
The enacted lesson does not connect or has weak connections to students' prior skills and understandings

sections.description: The enacted lesson intentionally targets the aspect(s) of Rigor (conceptual understanding, procedural skill and fluency, application) called for by the standard(s) being addressed

ratings.description: The enacted lesson explicitly targets the aspect(s) of Rigor called for by the standard(s) being addressed
The enacted lesson targets aspects of Rigor that are not appropriate for the standard(s) being addressed

title: Employ instructional practices that allow all students to learn the content of the lesson

sections.description: The teacher makes the mathematics of the lesson explicit through the use of explanations, representations, tasks, and/or examples

ratings.description: A variety of instructional techniques and examples are used to make the mathematics of the lesson clear
Examples are used to make the mathematics of the lesson clear
Instruction is limited to showing students how to get the answer
Instruction is not focused on the mathematics of the lesson

sections.description: The teacher strengthens all students' understanding of the content by strategically sharing students' representations and/or solution methods

ratings.description: Student solution methods are shared, and connections to the mathematics are explicit and purposeful. If applicable, connections between the methods are examined
Student solution methods are shared, and some mathematical connections are made between them
Student solution methods are shared, but few connections are made to strengthen student understanding
Student solution methods are not shared

title: Provide all students with opportunities to exhibit mathematical practices while engaging with the content of the lesson

sections.description: The teacher provides opportunities for all students to work with and practice grade-level problems and exercises
sections.studentBehavior: Students work with and practice grade-level problems and exercises

ratings.description: Teacher provides many opportunities, and most students take them
Teacher provides many opportunities, and some students take them; or teacher provides some opportunities and most students take them
Teacher provides some opportunities, and some students take them
Teacher provides few or no opportunities, or few or very few students take the opportunities provided

sections.description: The teacher cultivates reasoning and problem solving by allowing students to productively struggle
sections.studentBehavior: Students persevere in solving problems in the face of difficulty

ratings.description: Teacher provides many opportunities, and most students take them
Teacher provides many opportunities, and some students take them; or teacher provides some opportunities and most students take them
Teacher provides some opportunities, and some students take them
Teacher provides few or no opportunities, or few or very few students take the opportunities provided

sections.description: The teacher poses questions and problems that prompt students to explain their thinking about the content of the lesson
sections.studentBehavior: Students share their thinking about the content of the lesson beyond just stating answers

ratings.description: Teacher provides many opportunities, and most students take them
Teacher provides many opportunities, and some students take them; or teacher provides some opportunities and most students take them
Teacher provides some opportunities, and some students take them
Teacher provides few or no opportunities, or few or very few students take the opportunities provided

sections.description: The teacher creates the conditions for student conversations where students are encouraged to talk about each other's thinking
sections.studentBehavior: Students talk and ask questions about each other's thinking, in order to clarify or improve their own mathematical understanding

ratings.description: Teacher provides many opportunities, and most students take them
Teacher provides many opportunities, and some students take them; or teacher provides some opportunities and most students take them
Teacher provides some opportunities, and some students take them
Teacher provides few or no opportunities, or few or very few students take the opportunities provided

sections.description: The teacher connects and develops students' informal language and mathematical ideas to precise mathematical language and ideas
sections.studentBehavior: Students use increasingly precise mathematical language and ideas

ratings.description: Teacher provides many opportunities, and most students take them
Teacher provides many opportunities, and some students take them; or teacher provides some opportunities and most students take them
Teacher provides some opportunities, and some students take them
Teacher provides few or no opportunities, or few or very few students take the opportunities provided
